intro: Tristania elliptica, commonly known as the Tristania oval, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Tristania elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
